intro: Melanthesa neocaledonica var. forsteri, commonly known as the New Caledonian melampodium, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange ray florets and green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of the region. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or clay soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
